00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_tree_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_tree_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 #include "object.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * @file git2/tree.h
00035  * @brief Git tree parsing, loading routines
00036  * @defgroup git_tree Git tree parsing, loading routines
00037  * @ingroup Git
00038  * @{
00039  */
00040 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Lookup a tree object from the repository.
00044  *
00045  * @param tree pointer to the looked up tree
00046  * @param repo the repo to use when locating the tree.
00047  * @param id identity of the tree to locate.
00048  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00049  */
00050 GIT_INLINE(int) git_tree_lookup(git_tree **tree, git_repository *repo, const git_oid *id)
00051 {
00052         return git_object_lookup((git_object **)tree, repo, id, GIT_OBJ_TREE);
00053 }
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * Close an open tree
00057  *
00058  * This is a wrapper around git_object_close()
00059  *
00060  * IMPORTANT:
00061  * It *is* necessary to call this method when you stop
00062  * using a tree. Failure to do so will cause a memory leak.
00063  *
00064  * @param tree the tree to close
00065  */
00066 
00067 GIT_INLINE(void) git_tree_close(git_tree *tree)
00068 {
00069         git_object_close((git_object *) tree);
00070 }
00071 
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Get the id of a tree.
00075  *
00076  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00077  * @return object identity for the tree.
00078  */
00079 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tree_id(git_tree *tree);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * Get the number of entries listed in a tree
00083  *
00084  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00085  * @return the number of entries in the tree
00086  */
00087 GIT_EXTERN(size_t) git_tree_entrycount(git_tree *tree);
00088 
00089 /**
00090  * Lookup a tree entry by its filename
00091  *
00092  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00093  * @param filename the filename of the desired entry
00094  * @return the tree entry; NULL if not found
00095  */
00096 GIT_EXTERN(git_tree_entry *) git_tree_entry_byname(git_tree *tree, const char *filename);
00097 
00098 /**
00099  * Lookup a tree entry by its position in the tree
00100  *
00101  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00102  * @param idx the position in the entry list
00103  * @return the tree entry; NULL if not found
00104  */
00105 GIT_EXTERN(git_tree_entry *) git_tree_entry_byindex(git_tree *tree, int idx);
00106 
00107 /**
00108  * Get the UNIX file attributes of a tree entry
00109  *
00110  * @param entry a tree entry
00111  * @return attributes as an integer
00112  */
00113 GIT_EXTERN(unsigned int) git_tree_entry_attributes(git_tree_entry *entry);
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * Get the filename of a tree entry
00117  *
00118  * @param entry a tree entry
00119  * @return the name of the file
00120  */
00121 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_tree_entry_name(git_tree_entry *entry);
00122 
00123 /**
00124  * Get the id of the object pointed by the entry
00125  *
00126  * @param entry a tree entry
00127  * @return the oid of the object
00128  */
00129 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tree_entry_id(git_tree_entry *entry);
00130 
00131 /**
00132  * Convert a tree entry to the git_object it points too.
00133  *
00134  * @param object pointer to the converted object
00135  * @param repo repository where to lookup the pointed object
00136  * @param entry a tree entry
00137  * @return a reference to the pointed object in the repository
00138  */
00139 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tree_entry_2object(git_object **object_out, git_repository *repo, git_tree_entry *entry);
00140 
00141 /** @} */
00142 GIT_END_DECL
00143 #endif
